utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm tellin' you Ross, she wants you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She barely knows me. We just live in the same building.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Any contact?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She lent me an egg once.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You're in!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Aw, right.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Hi, Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Come on, Ross, you gotta get back in the game here, ok? The Rachel thing's not happening, your ex-wife is a lesbian—I don't think we need a third...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Excuse me, could we get an egg over here, still in the shell? Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: An egg?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, you're gonna go up to her and say, "Here's your egg back, I'm returning your egg."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think it's winning.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I think it's insane.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She'll love it. Go with the egg, my friend.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Think it'll work?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, it's suicide. The man's got an egg.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You can not do this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do what, do what?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Roger wants to take her out tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! Phoebes! Don't you remember why you dumped the guy?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: 'Cause he was creepy, and mean, and a little frightening... alright, still, it's nice to have a date on Valentine's Day!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But Phoebe, you can go out with a creepy guy any night of the year. I know I do.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, what are you guys doing tomorrow night?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Actually, tomorrow night kinda depends on how tonight goes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, uh, listen, about tonight...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no, don't you dare bail on me. The only reason she's goin' out with me is because I said I could bring a friend for her friend.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, I know, but her friend sounds like such a...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pathetic mess? I know, but—come on, man, she's needy, she's vulnerable. I'm thinkin', cha-ching! Thanks. Look, you have not been out with a woman since Janice. You're doin' this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi. She said yes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes! Way to go, man! Still got the egg, huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How do I look?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, uh, I... don't... care. Ok, now, remember, no trading. You get the pretty one, I get the mess.

utterance.speaker: Lorraine
utterance.content: Hi, Joey. Well well, look what you brought. Very nice.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ...And what did you bring?

utterance.speaker: Lorraine
utterance.content: She's checking the coats. Joey, I'm gonna go wash the cab smell off my hands. Will you get me a white Zinfandel, and a glass of red for Janice.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Janice?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh.... my.... God.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, it's Janice.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, I'm makin' a break for it, I'm goin' out the window.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no, don't! I've been waitin' for like, forever to go out with Lorraine. Just calm down.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Calm down? Calm down? You set me up with the woman that I've dumped twice in the last five months!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Can you stop yellin'? You're makin' me nervous, and I can't go when I'm nervous.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, you're right. Come on, do it, do it, go, come on!!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, ok, Roger was creepy, but he was nothing compared to Pete Carney.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Which one was Pete Carney?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pete the Weeper? Remember that guy who used to cry every time we had sex. "Was it good for you?"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I'll take a little crying any day over Howard-the-"I-win"-guy. "I win! I win!" I went out with the guy for two months—I didn't get to win once.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How did we end up with these jerks? We're good people!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't know. Maybe we're some kinda magnets.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know I am. That's why I can't wear a digital watch.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: There's more beer, right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! You know my friend Abby who shaves her head? She said that if you want to break the bad boyfriend cycle, you can do like a cleansing ritual.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebes, this woman is voluntarily bald.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. So, we can do it tomorrow night, you guys. It's Valentine's Day. It's perfect.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok, well, what kind of ritual?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok. We can, um, we can burn the stuff they gave us.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Or?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Or...or we can chant and dance around naked, you know, with sticks.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Burning's good.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Burning's good. Yeah, I got stuff to burn.

utterance.speaker: Lorraine
utterance.content: You know, ever since I was little, I've been able to pick up quarters with my toes.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Good for you. Uh, quarters or rolls of quarters?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: By the way, Chandler. I cut you out of all my pictures. So if you want, I have a bag with just your heads.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's OK.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh, are you sure? Really? Because you know, you could make little puppets out of them, and you could use them in your theater of cruelty.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: We can't do that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What? What can't you do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, can I talk to you for a second, over there?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, we might be leaving now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Tell me it's "you and me" we.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: She said she wants to slather my body with stuff and then lick it off. I'm not even sure what slathering is, but I definitely want to be a part of it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, you can not do this to me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You're right, I'm sorry. You're right.

utterance.speaker: Lorraine
utterance.content: Uh, can we have three chocolate mousses to go please?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm outta here. Here's my credit card. Dinner's on me. I'm sorry, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I hope she throws up on you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So...

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Just us.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, what a crappy night!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Although, I have enjoyed the fact that, uh your shirt's been stickin' outta your zipper ever since you came back from the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Excuse me. How ya doin'?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: So, do we have the best friends or what?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey's not a friend. He's...a stupid man who left us his credit card. Another drink? Some dessert? A big screen TV?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: I will go for that drink.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You got it. Good woman! Could we get a bottle of your most overpriced champagne?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Each.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's right, each. Oh, and a uh Rob Roy. I've always wanted to know...

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Happy Valentine's Day!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh, I miss you already. Can you believe this happened?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No... no! And yet it did. Good-bye, Janice.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Kiss me!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, Chandler, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohhh, Chandler, sorry! Hey, Janice.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Hi, Monica.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, well, this was very special.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rach, come see who's out here!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my god. Janice, hi!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Janice is gonna go away now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Joey, look who it is.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, good, Joey's home now.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: This is so fun. This is like a reunion in the hall.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, hi, Ross. Yeah. There's someone I want you to say hi to. He just happened to call.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Hi, Ross. Yes, it's me. How did you know?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm just sayin' if dogs do experience jet lag, then, because of the whole um, seven dog years to one human year thing, then, when a dog flies from New York to Los Angeles, he doesn't just lose three hours, he loses like a week and a half.

utterance.speaker: Kristin
utterance.content: That's funny. Who are they?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The blond woman is my ex-wife, and the woman touching her is her... close, personal friend.

utterance.speaker: Kristin
utterance.content: You mean they're lovers.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: If you wanna put a label on it.

utterance.speaker: Kristin
utterance.content: Wow, uh, anything else I should know?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nope, nope, that's it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, and she's pregnant with my baby. I always forget that part. Helloo!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok, so now we need, um sage branches and the sacramental wine.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All I have is, is oregano and a Fresca.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Um, that's ok! Ok. All right. Now we need the semen of a righteous man.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, Pheebs, you know what, if we had that, we wouldn't be doing the ritual in the first place.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Can we just start throwing things in?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok, yeah, ok. Oh, OK.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, Barry's letters. Adam Ritter's boxer shorts.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok, and I have the, uh receipt for my dinner with Nokululu Oon Ah Ah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look, here's a picture of Scotty Jared naked.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey he's wearing a sweater.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Phoebe
utterance.content: Eww!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And here we have the last of Paulo's grappa.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, Rachel, isn't that stuff almost pure...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How can I dump this woman on Valentine's day?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don't know. You dumped her on New Year's.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, man. In my next life, I'm coming back as a toilet brush.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Hello, funny Valentine.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi, Just Janice.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Hello, Joey, our little matchmaker. I could just kiss you all over, and I'm gonna!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: If you don't do it, I will.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, um, what do you do for a living?

utterance.speaker: Kristin
utterance.content: Well, um, for the past few years I've been working.....which is funny because, that wasn't even my major.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Oh no. I thought you said they could shoot the spot without you.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: I thought they could...I'll try to get back as soon as I can. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Now that is funny. Hey, do you think...would it be too weird if I invited Carol over to join us? 'Cause she's, she's alone now, and pregnant, and, and sad.

utterance.speaker: Kristin
utterance.content: I guess.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are you sure? Great. Carol? Wanna come over and join us?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Oh, no no no. I'm fine. I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on. These people'll scooch down. You guys'll scooch, won't you? Let's try scooching! Come on. Come on. Uh, Kristen Riggs, this is Carol Willick. Carol, Kristin. Uh, Carol teaches sixth grade. And, Kristin, Kristin......does something that, funnily enough, wasn't even her major!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You know, it's a really funny story how this happened.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: I brought you something.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is it loaded? Oh, little candy hearts. Chan and Jan Forever.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: I had them made special.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, Janice. Janice. Hey, Janice. Look, there's no way for me to tell you this. At least there's no new way for me to tell you this. I just don't things are gonna work out.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: That's fine.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It is?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Mmm-hmm. Because I know that this isn't the end.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no, you see, actually it is.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: No, it isn't, because you won't let that happen. Don't you know it yet? You love me, Chandler Bing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, no I don't.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Well then ask yourself this. Why do you think we keep ending up together? New Year's? Who invited who? Valentine's? Who asked who into whose bed?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I did, but...

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: You seek me out. Something deep in your soul calls out to me like a foghorn. Janice, Janice. You want me. You need me. You can't live without me. And you know it. You just don't know you know it. See ya.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Call me!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: It's not true. I never called your mother a wolverine.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You did so. I swear, I swear— How long has she been in the bathroom?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Uh, I don't think she's in the bathroom. Her coat is gone.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well maybe it's cold in there. Or maybe I screwed up the first date I had in 9 years.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: That could be it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, god. You know, this is still pretty hot.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Mushroom. Smile. They won't all be like this. Some women might even stay through dinner. Sorry, that's not funny

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, it's just...you know the whole "getting on with your life" thing. Well, do I have to? I mean, I'm sitting here with this cute woman, and, and, and she's perfectly nice, and, but that there's, that's it. And um, and then I'm here talkin' to you, and, and it's easy, and it's fun, and, and I don't, I don't have to...You know, here's a wacky thought. Um, what's say you and I give it another shot? No no no, I know what you're gonna say, you're a lesbian. But what do you say we just put that aside for now you know? Let's just stick a pin in it, ok? Because, we're great together, you know. You can't deny it. Besides, you're carrying my baby. I mean, how perfect is that? But see, you know, you keep sayin' that, but there's somethin' right here. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Oh, I love you too. But...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No but, no but.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: You know that thing you put over here with the pin in it? It's time to take the pin out. You'll find someone, I know you will. The right woman is just waiting for you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's easy for you to say, you found one already.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: All you need is a woman who likes men and you'll be set.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Not her.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, um, will you bring the truck?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, my god.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: See, there you go, the cleansing works!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They're nice guys.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, they're firemen guys.
